Spike protein (S) is a viral type I transmembrane glycoprotein (~180-200 kDa) responsible for CoVs interaction and invasion of host cells.

64 This protein is synthesised as a monomer and suffers post-translational modifications in the ER before becoming a trimeric glycosylated protein.
59

116 Its structure is divided into three main domains: an extracellular, a transmembrane and a short intracellular domain ( Fig. 11).
117 The former protrudes from the surface of the virus particle creating a crown-like halo and contains two functional subunits: S1 (bulbous shape), which binds to cellular receptors (e.g., ACE2), and S2 (stalk shape) that promotes the fusion between cell and virus membranes.
59 In turn, S1 subunit has two domains: a N-terminal and a C-terminal domain. The latter serves as a RBD for SARS-CoVs being responsible for ACE2 recognition and binding.
